examples: they claimed that they had been in contact with extraterrestrial beings
her fingers came in contact with the light switch

definitions.text: the state or condition of touching or of being in immediate proximity
examples: litmus paper turns red on contact with an acid

definitions.text: the physical coming together of two or more things
examples: contact with the pier scraped paint from the hull

definitions.text: a person who is in a position to give you special assistance
examples: he used his business contacts to get an introduction to the governor

definitions.text: a channel for communication between groups
examples: he provided a liaison with the guerrillas

definitions.text: (electronics) a junction where things (as two electrical conductors) touch or are in physical contact
examples: they forget to solder the contacts
the pilot made contact with the base
he got in touch with his colleagues

definitions.text: a thin curved glass or plastic lens designed to fit over the cornea in order to correct vision or to deliver medication
be in or establish communication with
examples: He never contacted his children after he emigrated to Australia

definitions.text: be in direct physical contact with; make contact
examples: The wire must not contact the metal cover
The surfaces contact at this point
